FasterBCController

Method Detail

create

public int create(int netID,
                  int tmID)
This method constructs a BCC based Betweenness calculator that accepts arbitrary Traffic Matrices. Accepting arbitrary Traffic Matrices as an input argument causes awful running times. This algorithm should only be used if the network is almost a tree.

Parameters:
netID -
tmID -
Returns:

create

public int create(int netID)
This method constructs a BCC based Betweenness calculator that assumes a default traffic matrix. It works by partitioning the network into bi-connected components and computing betweenness separately within each component. Its running times are almost always better than of the Brandes (2001) algorithm.

Parameters:
netID -
tmID -
Returns:

createFromSE

public int createFromSE(int netID,
                        int tmID)
This method constructs a BCC based Betweenness calculator that assumes that the network AND the Traffic Matrix were created using SE.createUnifiedNetwork(..) and SE.createUnifiedCW(..) respectively. It works by partitioning the unified network into bi-connected components and computing betweenness separately within each component. Its running time is almost always better than of the Brandes (2001) algorithm.

Parameters:
netID - created by Structural Equivalence unifier.
tmID - created by Structural Equivalence unifier.
Returns:
algID

createAsynch

public int createAsynch(int netID)
Starts an execution that creates Faster BC algorithm with the given network.

Parameters:
network - index
Returns:
Execution index in the Database

createAsynch

public int createAsynch(int netID,
                        int tmID)
Starts an execution that creates Faster BC algorithm with the given network and traffic matrix. The algorithm created uses assumes BCCalculatorAlgorithm.TRAFIC_MATRIX_BC

Parameters:
network - index
tmID - - Traffic Matrix index
Returns:
Execution index in the Database

createAsynch

public int createAsynch(int netID,
                        int tmID,
                        int bcCalculatorType)
Starts an execution that creates Faster BC algorithm with the given network, traffic matrix, and bcCalculatorType. If DEFAULT is given then the network and the traffic matrix must have been created using SE.createUnifiedNetwork(..) and SE.createUnifiedCW(..) respectively.

Parameters:
netID - - network index
tmID - - Traffic Matrix index
bcCalculatorType - - DEFAULT = 0, TRAFIC_MATRIX_BC = 1
Returns:
Execution index in the Database

getBetweenness

public java.lang.Object[] getBetweenness(int algID,
                                         int[] vertices)
Returns an array of betweenness values of the given vertices in the given Faster BC algorithm instance. The order of the betweenness values in the array corresponds to the order of the given vertices.

Parameters:
algorithm - index
array - of vertices
Returns:
array of betweenness values

getBetweenness

public java.lang.Object[] getBetweenness(int algID)
Returns an array of betweenness values of all vertices in the given Faster BC algorithm instance. The order of the betweenness values in the array corresponds to the order of the vertices in the graph.

Parameters:
algorithm - index
Returns:
array of betweenness values

getSumGroup

public double getSumGroup(int algID,
                          java.lang.Object[] vertices)
Returns the sum of betweenness values of the given vertices in the given Faster BC algorithm instance.

Parameters:
algorithm - index
array - of vertices
Returns:
betweenness value

getComponentsStatistics

public java.lang.Object[] getComponentsStatistics(int algID)
Returns an array with statistical values of the given Faster BC algorithm instance. statistics[0] is number of components statistics[1] is avg component size statistics[2] is max component size

Parameters:
algorithm - index
Returns:
statistics array
